channel.title: Product-Update on Sujith Quintelier
channel.description: Recent content in Product-Update on Sujith Quintelier

item.title: github: Repository dashboard is now generally available
item.description:
GitHub’s repository dashboard has moved from public preview to general availability. It lets users find, filter, and save custom views of repositories they can access.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved pull request “Files changed” page on by default
item.description:
GitHub has made the improved pull request “Files changed” experience the default for all users. The experience, previously available in public preview, is intended to be familiar while enhancing how files are viewed and reviewed in pull requests.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Plan before you build, steer as you go
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that introduce more powerful reasoning models and intelligent workflow features, enabling developers to plan work before generating code and to steer interactive terminal conversations as they go.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Teams management now moved to Settings
item.description:
GitHub moved Teams management out of the left-hand navigation into a dedicated page under Settings to simplify navigation and surface other important features more easily.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs
item.description:
GitHub announced dynamic Copilot prompts on GitHub Docs, allowing users to launch GitHub Copilot prompts directly from select documentation pages to move seamlessly from reading docs to using Copilot.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Spark: Improvements, DPA coverage, & dedicated SKU
item.description:
GitHub announced a set of improvements for Spark, introduced a dedicated Spark SKU, and confirmed that Spark is covered by the GitHub Data Processing Agreement (DPA).

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot Spaces: Public spaces and code view support
item.description:
GitHub announced three major updates to Copilot Spaces: support for public spaces, individual sharing controls, and the ability to add files to a space directly from the github.com code viewer.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved onboarding flow for GitHub Projects
item.description:
GitHub updated the Projects onboarding flow to help users start faster by adding options to connect and import items from a repository and to set a default repository for new issues.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: A mission control to assign, steer, and track Copilot coding agent tasks
item.description:
GitHub redesigned the Copilot coding agent task management experience on github.com into a single “mission control” interface that lets you assign, steer, and track tasks without jumping between pages.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Grok Code Fast 1 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Grok Code Fast 1 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot and can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat. The release is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Copilot-generated commit messages on github.com are generally available
item.description:
GitHub Copilot now provides contextual commit message suggestions for file changes on github.com. The feature, previously in public preview, is now generally available to help make writing commit documentation easier and faster.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now generally available in GitHub Copilot
item.description:
Anthropic’s Claude Sonnet 4.5 is now generally available inside GitHub Copilot. The model can be accessed in GitHub Copilot Chat and is available to Copilot Enterprise, Copilot Business, Copilot Pro, and Copilot Pro+ customers.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Faster, more concise, and prettier
item.description:
GitHub announced incremental updates to GitHub Copilot CLI focused on speed, more concise suggestions, and improved output formatting. The changes reflect daily improvements driven by community feedback and are listed in the GitHub Blog changelog.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: GitHub Copilot CLI: Enhanced model selection, image support, and streamlined UI
item.description:
GitHub announced updates to Copilot CLI that add enhanced model selection, support for images, and a streamlined user interface following the product’s public preview and active user feedback.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: azure: [Launched] Generally Available: Azure SQL hub experience in Azure portal
item.description:
Azure announced the general availability of the Azure SQL hub in the Azure portal — a new centralized experience that brings together everything related to Azure SQL. The hub is designed to simplify choosing the right Azure SQL service and support both new and experienced users.

  • Source: Azure Updates

item.title: github: New features in GitHub Copilot in Eclipse
item.description:
GitHub shipped improvements to GitHub Copilot in Eclipse that add more context options, smoother workflows, and better customization to make the extension smarter and easier to use.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Profile menu enhancements in global navigation
item.description:
GitHub updated the profile menu in global navigation to make it more action-specific, simpler, and faster to reach common destinations.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: The dashboard-feed page gets a refreshed, faster experience
item.description:
GitHub updated the /dashboard-feed page to align it with improvements made to the homepage “For you” feed, delivering a refreshed, more consistent, and faster experience across the site.

  • Source: GitHub

item.title: github: Improved file navigation and editing in the web UI
item.description:
GitHub announced improvements to the web UI to make file navigation and editing faster and simpler. A highlighted change is seamless editing from search results so that search hits link directly to files with the ability to open and edit them in the web editor.

  • Source: GitHub
